akn:section.akn:heading: Licenses: military reservations; erection and use of buildings; Young Men’s Christian Association

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 7778. Licenses: military reservations; erection and use of buildings; Young Men’s Christian Association Under such conditions as he may prescribe, the Secretary of the Army may issue a revocable license to the International Committee of Young Men’s Christian Associations of North America to erect and maintain on military reservations, inside the United States and the Commonwealths and possessions, buildings needed by that organization for the promotion of the social, physical, intellectual, and moral welfare of the members of the Army on those reservations. (Aug. 10, 1956, ch. 1041, 70A Stat. 270, § 4778; Pub. L. 109–163, div. A, title X, § 1057(a)(5), (6), Jan. 6, 2006, 119 Stat. 3440, 3441; Pub. L. 111–383, div. A, title X, § 1075(h)(4)(A)(i), Jan. 7, 2011, 124 Stat. 4377; renumbered § 7778, Pub. L. 115–232, div. A, title VIII, § 808(d), Aug. 13, 2018, 132 Stat. 1839.)
Historical and Revision Notes

477810:1346.May 31, 1902, ch. 943, 32 Stat. 282.
The words “may issue” are substituted for the words “Authority is given to * * * in his discretion, to grant permission”. The words “Under such conditions as he may prescribe” are substituted for the words “under such regulations as the Secretary of the Army may impose”. The words “members of the Army” are substituted for the word “garrisons”. The words “the Territories, Commonwealths, and possessions” are substituted for the words “or its island possessions” for clarity.
